intro: Spermacoce semierecta, commonly known as the upright bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, often erect stems. Its small white or yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, spherical fruits known as capsules. Spermacoce semierecta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
